main event: A bright light, approximately ten times the apparent size of a star, was observed drifting in the sky over Misawa Air Base in Japan.
interesting points: The object exhibited varying intensity and appeared to be slowly rotating., Observations indicated that the light was much larger than a star and was brighter than Sirius., The movement of the light appeared to be slow and northward., Witnesses reported the light's color ranged from pinkish white to reddish white., The conclusion drawn was that the observed light was Venus, aided by atmospheric distortion.
sighted object: a bright, luminous object in the sky
witness description: Air Force personnel including a navigator
